parameters: <ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>

\N<Hojiko's Wife>I heard from my husband, you know? They say you're still
fighting in the training corps.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>It's really quite a hardship, isn't it? No matter how much
it's for Yuia-san's sake, what drives you to go so far?

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe... With a face and body like yours, you wouldn't need
to do all that. You could easily ingratiate yourself with
the Ludan folks and have them accommodate you, right?
A
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>

\N<Hojiko's Wife>I heard from my husband, you know? They say you're still
fighting in the training corps.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>It's really quite a hardship, isn't it? No matter how much

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe... With a face and body like yours, you wouldn't need

A

\N<Hojiko's Wife>I heard from my husband, you know? They say you're still
fighting in the training corps.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>It's quite a tough job, isn't it? No matter how much it's
for Yuia-san's sake, what drives you to go so far?

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe... With a face and body like yours, you wouldn't need
to do all that. You could easily ingratiate yourself with
the Luda folks and have them accommodate you, right?
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Even so, both you and Irime are really going through a lot
for your husbands. I could never do that, ahaha.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Especially Irime, she's quite the odd one. To wear herself
out for such a useless husband. Well, I guess that can't be
helped when it comes to her.

\N<Segi>By any chance, do you know anything about Mr. Irime's
illness?

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Of course. Most people in this town would know, wouldn't
they? Well, it happened before you and Yuia-san came to
town.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>There was a time when her childhood friend, who later became
her husband, got injured protecting Irime. That injury led
to his current condition, and eventually, he fell ill. And
that brings us to today.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>That's probably why Irime is fighting in the military drills
in place of her husband. If it were me, I'd leave such a
husband and find a new man, but she's a foolish woman,
ahaha.
\N<Segi>...
C

\N<Hojiko's Wife>There was a time when my childhood friend, who became my
husband, got injured protecting Irime. That incident led to
his current condition, and eventually, he fell ill. And that
brings us to where we are now.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>That's probably why Irime is fighting in the military drills
as a stand-in for my husband. If it were me, I'd have left
such a husband and found a new man, but she's a foolish
woman, haha.

<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, hesitation is forbidden in the next battle. Even
if the opponent is your friend.
\N<Segi>...Yes.

\N<Rozaro>Your strength and that of Miss Irime are evenly matched.
Therefore, whether you can be ruthless in the fight will be
the key to victory.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Rozaro>What's wrong, Segi-san?

\N<Segi>Rozaro-san... I know it's presumptuous of me. But even so, I
have something I'd like to consult with you about.

\N<Segi>Is there any way to win against Miss Irime without hurting
her?

\N<Segi>As things stand, no matter the outcome, too many people will
be saddened, including Miss Irime's master, Rame-chan, and
Riia...

\N<Rozaro>I told you, if you let sentiment get in the way, you will be
defeated. Do you understand what that means?
\N<Segi>But...

\N<Rozaro>Weren't you prepared to fight in the training corps in
Yuia's place? Did you realize that you might have to trample
over those close to you and now you're wavering?
\N<Segi>Maybe... that's possible.

\N<Rozaro>With such resolve, you won't be able to save anyone
important to you, not Yuia nor Riia. If you go into battle
with half-hearted determination, you'll end up losing
everything in the end.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>With such half-hearted resolve, neither Yuia nor Riia will
be able to save anyone dear to them. If you go into battle
with such indecision, you'll end up losing everything in the
end.

\N<Rozaro>Actually, I've been thinking since then. Is there really no
way to win without hurting Miss Irime, just as you said?
\N<Segi>Could it be... there is a way? What kind of...?

\N<Rozaro>It's simple, we just need to weaken her and completely
immobilize her movements. Then we can force her to
surrender.

\N<Segi>Immobilize her movements... Is that something I can possibly
do?

\N<Rozaro>To be honest, I don't know. But fortunately, there's still
time before the match. Let's not give up and think together
for the best method.
\N<Segi>...Yes.
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, good timing. I have something to discuss with you.
It's about yesterday's conversation... there is a way.

\N<Segi>Are you talking about a way to do it without hurting Irime-
san?

\N<Rozaro>Yes, that's right. To put it bluntly... we weaken and
capture her. We can use poison to incapacitate her so she
can't continue fighting. Then we force her to surrender.
\N<Segi>Poison...

\N<Rozaro>That's right. I believe it's the only way... what do you
think?
\N<Segi>I'm sorry, but... I can't do that.

\N<Segi>If we did that, we don't know what kind of aftereffects
there might be, and depending on the amount, it could even
lead to death...

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, your kindness is one of your greatest charms. But
if you keep talking like that, won't you end up getting hurt
yourself?

\N<Segi>I understand that... which is why I want to somehow make
them understand through negotiation.

\N<Rozaro>It's futile. Try looking at it from the opposite
perspective. If you were in their shoes, would you accept
defeat and agree to the terms proposed by your opponent?

\N<Rozaro>Could you sacrifice yourself or your family for the sake of
the enemy's family or something precious to them?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>It may sound harsh, but this is the nature of the battle
we're in.

\N<Rozaro>It might not be nice to say this, but I want you to win the
upcoming battle. For that reason, I even think it's
inevitable that Irime-san gets hurt.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>I can't think of any other way. What will you do? Shall I
arrange it?
\N<Segi>I'll try to figure something out myself.
\N<Rozaro>...I see.

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, I can more than guess how difficult this is for
you. But even so, I...
\N<Segi>...
weather : 0 : 5 : 5 : 15 : 1 : Light_01D : 1
weather : 1 : 5 : 5 : 5 : 1 : Light_01C : 1

\N<Segi>If we bare our fangs at anyone and everyone just to protect
ourselves or our family... eventually, it will come back to
haunt us.

\N<Segi>If we start justifying acts that harm others for our own
sake, then we're no different from the Ludans.

\N<Segi>Rozaro-san... I'm not being kind or naive. If it's for the
sake of Lord Yuia or Riia, I've been ready for a long time.
\N<Segi>But... even so.

\N<Segi>I just don't want to cross that line where I have to
eliminate someone important to protect someone else until
the very last moment...

\N<Segi>But... I do understand what you're saying, Rozaro-san. Even
if not poison, if there was something that could temporarily
restrain Irime-san's actions...
B

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, I can more than imagine how hard this must be for
you. But even so, I...

\N<Man>If you don't need anything, please don't talk to me.
Drinking here is the only way I can forget this harsh
reality...

\N<Man>The residents have started fighting each other at the
training sessions, and everyone's becoming more
aggressive... Perhaps it's part of Luda's group's plan.

\N<Man>These days, even the soldiers of Luda are showing up in
places like this. I just want to drink my booze in peace...

\N<Man>I don't have the strength to win matches, nor do I have the
power to train myself against monsters in the ruins. Is it
my fate to just die like this...

\N<Man>It's embarrassing to admit, but my wife and I have grown
cold towards each other, and we no longer function as a
married couple.

\N<Man>And yet, why must I risk my life for her by participating in
the training soldiers' tournament...
\N<Segi>...I have to go pick up Riia.
\N<Segi>...I have to go pick up Riia.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Whether they're from Luda or not, a customer is a customer.
As long as I get paid, I'll provide the appropriate
hospitality.

\N<Shopkeeper>There's no point in being stubborn about it, after all, I've
got to make a living too.
<ActiveMessage:\C[10]■Event■>
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>What's the matter, standing there like that? If you've come
here, does that mean you've come to work?

\N<Shopkeeper>I was hoping you'd come. Sure, it might have been a series
of misfortunes for the missus, but I've made sure to provide
a fair compensation for that.

\N<Segi>I... I didn't come here intending to sell my heart along
with my labor for a reward.

\N<Shopkeeper>I understand, you and our establishment are in the same
boat, so to speak. That's why I want to help you out for
your sake.

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. Are you convinced? As usual, I've
prepared a change of clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on
you, okay?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>What's the matter, standing there like that? If you've come
here, does that mean you've come to work?
\N<Segi>But, still...

\N<Shopkeeper>Ah, are you talking about last time? Well, in this kind of
business, all sorts of things happen at the drinking table.

\N<Shopkeeper>But still, you came here despite that. Isn't that your
answer? It's none other than yourself who needs to earn a
living here, right?
\N<Segi>That is...

\N<Shopkeeper>I said I wouldn't get involved in your personal
circumstances. Of course, serving here isn't something I'd
force on you.

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. Are you convinced? As usual, I've
prepared a change of clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on
you, okay?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Hey there, glad you came, missus. I was thinking you'd come
again.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Heh, you won't attract any customers with such a gloomy
face. You've got to be brighter if you're going to be out in
front of people, right?

\N<Shopkeeper>Of course, I won't get involved in your personal
circumstances. I have no intention of sticking my nose where
it doesn't belong. Our relationship is strictly business.

\N<Shopkeeper>Heh, feeling relieved? As usual, I've prepared a change of
clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on you, okay?
\N<Segi>Um...

\N<Shopkeeper>Glad you came again, missus. Just between us, I actually
thought you would come.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Ah, rest assured. I'm not interested in your personal
circumstances.

\N<Shopkeeper>What matters is that you can attract customers. And I can
reward you for that. That's what's important.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Shall we get straight to business then? Although this time
there's no need for you to go gather materials. All I'm
asking for is your service as a hostess. Of course, the
reward will be generous.
\N<Segi>Wait, please. I haven't yet agreed to take on any job...
\N<Shopkeeper>...Is that so?
\N<Segi>...Yes.
\N<Shopkeeper>Hahaha, let's forget about the troublesome stuff for now.

\N<Shopkeeper>Like I said earlier, I can compensate for your work. And in
the way that you desire most... right?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. As usual, I've prepared a change of
clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on you, okay?
\N<Segi>Um...
\N<Shopkeeper>Hm? What is it, missus?

\N<Segi>That is... I saw the request board. If it's alright with
you, I thought maybe I could be of some help...
\N<Shopkeeper>The request board? You're going to take on a job from it?
\N<Segi>Yes, if it's okay with you, I would like to help out.

\N<Shopkeeper>That would be a great help. If it's the missus taking on the
job, it's all I could ask for.
\N<Segi>...?
\N<Shopkeeper>Then, let me explain the details of the request right away.
\N<Segi>Yes, please do.

\N<Shopkeeper>Although it's a simple matter. What I want to ask of you is
some easy assistance with customer service.

\N<Segi>Assistance with customer service... Understood. So what
should I do...?

\N<Shopkeeper>Yeah, could you go upstairs for a bit? There's some
preparation there.
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, I'll talk about the specifics later. So I'm counting
on you, okay?

\N<Shopkeeper>Let's forget about all the troublesome stuff for now. Like I
said before, I can compensate for your hard work, my lady.
And in the way you desire the most... right?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. As usual, I've prepared a change of

\N<Shopkeeper>Whether they're from Luda or not, a customer is a customer.

\N<Shopkeeper>There's no point in being stubborn about it, after all, I've
